abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project was
            rated satisfactory. The key lessons learned through the
            project are the following: 1) A continuous long-term
            partnership with the Government pays off. The Bank should
            continue with this approach for future operations on
            contractual savings which deepen already initiated reforms.
            2) However, the Bank needs to be more realistic in the
            assessment of the feasibility of certain policy measures.
            For instance, the privatization program that was initially
            foreseen as part of this project conditions was too
            ambitious, probably because of insufficient financial and
            institutional analysis and/or of an optimistic assessment of
            the political constraints on privatization. A more rigorous
            approach would require a careful assessment of the different
            constraints and risks for each measure included in the loan.
